__data__.text:
"Been here a couple of times and Gusto never disappoints. Firstly, even for a busy restaurant they have plenty of outdoor seating (patio and rooftop) and would be happy to accommodate you irrespective of a booking or not (but we have been only 2 people though!)\

The food is excellent! The salads taste fresh, the appetizers are a good portion (lamb meatballs are super tasty!). The pastas are smaller in portion but have an impeccable taste (truffle paste is a must-try!!!!). Their tiramisu is one of the best I've tried in Toronto, SO SO GOOD!\
\
Lastly, their staff is friendly and service is quick. Would highly recommend it!"
\
"This place is great. The atmosphere is amazing. And the ground floor smells so good! We got a pasta, pizza and brussels sprouts app for two people. The brussels sprouts and pasta was 10/10! The pizza was more on the bottom side at 4/10. The crust was just too dry and not enough flavor. Maybe offer a dipping sauce? Their tiramisu was 9/10. It was a great portion. Enough for two people.\
\
We came here on a weekday at 5 pm because that is what their website said was available. But even at 7 pm, there were a lot of tables.\
\
Overall, good experience. We will be back for the pasta for sure!"
\
"Amazing Italian restaurant.\
\
The atmosphere as soon as you walked in was welcoming and exciting and it seemed like everybody there loved being there. We got seats on the rooftop and it was absolutely lovely.\
\
My table shared the eggplant appetizer and I got the mushroom pizza and both were phenomenal. I work at a pizza place so I don\'92t often enjoy other pizza but something about it this one was so good, I couldn\'92t resist.\
\
Our server was okay. He was kind and knew about the menu but not too amicable. It took a while for both the food and the bill to come, which I guess is normal for a Friday night but I still believe it could have been better.\
\
Perhaps a little pricey but, for the Toronto Fashion District, it\'92s about expected."
\
"Gusto 101 has a great ambience. It\'92s high ceilings and it\'92s industrial loft finishes really give it a cool feel and look.\
\
Great service and delicious food. The Octopus and Black Kale salad were fantastic!\
\
I ate more but forgot to take a photo as it was too delicious.\
\
I will definitely be back to Gusto 101"
\
"Food and the vibes are so good here.\
Calamari 9/10. Crispy with good sauce.\
Mushroom pasta 10/10 . Love these type of noodles & they were cooked perfectly aldente.\
Kale Caesar 8/10 (could use more kale massaging. A little rough tasting)\
We also got the 1oz for $1 deal on the wine. Red was very good."
\
"Food is great but it is sooo busy and loud( perhaps the architecture makes every noise echo) that makes it a bit stressful for dining.\
We had our usual mushroom pasta that was delicious but tried their steak for the first time and it was one of the best I\'92ve had!! I also really enjoyed the octopus as starter."
\
"We thoroughly enjoyed our time at this restaurant.\
We dined upstairs to appreciate the open rooftop.\
The food was great. We had the calamari, beef carpaccio and pizza.\
The calamari was a good portion, but small pieces. The beef carpaccio was so delicious. To compliment the dish, I wished it came with bread.\
We loved the pizza. Very tasty flavors.\
I would definitely come back again."
\
"Everything was very good \uc0\u55357 \u56845  especially the mushroom truffle

pasta that was delicious but tried their steak for the first time and it was one of the best I\'92ve had!! I also really enjoyed the octopus as starter."
\
"We thoroughly enjoyed our time at this restaurant.\
We dined upstairs to appreciate the open rooftop.\
The food was great. We had the calamari, beef carpaccio and pizza.\
The calamari was a good portion, but small pieces. The beef carpaccio was so delicious. To compliment the dish, I wished it came with bread.\
We loved the pizza. Very tasty flavors.\
I would definitely come back again."
\
"Everything was very good \uc0\u55357 \u56845  especially the mushroom truffle pasta.\
The Tiramisu has crunchy texture from the dry lady finger (I don't know if it was on purpose, or is there any mistake) so for the tiramisu it self it's not my go to.\
But the rest are amazing, service are amazing."
\
Went for my wife\'92s birthday and it was an absolute treat. We ordered focaccia and was tasteful. For mains. We ordered truffle sauce pasta and margarita pasta which was pure delight. The pasta is a must try if you are into white sauce and fungi/mushrooms. Would definitely go again.
\
Nice atmosphere, food was delicious. Our first waitress got annoyed about us wanting to move tables because it was getting too cold by the window. But the second waitress was much nicer and was extremely helpful. Would love to go back and try the other items on their menu.
\
"Went here for a birthday, which was my first time here. I ordered pizza, and focaccia.\
\
Everything was great, the pizza was not the best I ever had but very good. Except for the focaccia, which may have been the best I\'92ve ever had!\
\
The atmosphere is very welcoming including the beautiful patio out front. Washrooms are in the basement via stairs, not wheelchair assessable."
\
Ive heard about gusto for a few years now. As soon as I had the chance to go to Toronto I made a reservation. The truffle pasta did not disappoint and would definitely be back next time I\'92m around! Great service and food all throughout.
\
"If you want atmosphere and ambiance with tasty food, this is the place to go. The food is incredible and the wine is paid by the ounce on Tuesdays which makes it a good place for wine on a budget. The truffle pasta (malfam\'e9 ai fungi) was amazing. We went as a group of 4 and had focaccia, Brussel sprouts, kale salad and calamari to start with truffle pasta as our mains.\
I\'92m rating 4 stars as they forgot to celebrate our birthday! Our server was not attentive, we had to wait very long to get their attention and order and it took 40 minutes to get our bill with the server coming back to ask what we ordered to re-enter the items for the bill."
\
"It\'92s been forever since I ate here. First time was a few years ago.  It tastes the exact same as the first time.\
\
The mushroom pasta is easily 5/5 stars. The red sauce dish (forgot the name) could not live up to the deliciousness.\
\
The place is always crazy busy so expect to wait quite a while for a table"
\
First timer at Gusto! Popped by for some quick drinks and apps. Everything was super tasty plus the service was great. I\'92ll definitely be back for dinner next time because I seriously have to try the mushroom pasta (looks so good!)
\
"Recently visited Gusto 101 and we thoroughly enjoyed the vibe as well as food!! So good!\
I think it\'92s a great place to catch up with friends on an evening or for a lovely date. It\'92s a bit crowded

same as the first time.\
\
The mushroom pasta is easily 5/5 stars. The red sauce dish (forgot the name) could not live up to the deliciousness.\
\
The place is always crazy busy so expect to wait quite a while for a table"
\
First timer at Gusto! Popped by for some quick drinks and apps. Everything was super tasty plus the service was great. I\'92ll definitely be back for dinner next time because I seriously have to try the mushroom pasta (looks so good!)
\
"Recently visited Gusto 101 and we thoroughly enjoyed the vibe as well as food!! So good!\
I think it\'92s a great place to catch up with friends on an evening or for a lovely date. It\'92s a bit crowded though, yet enjoyable. The vibe is so cool with dim lights. I find it like a nice Instagrammable restaurant if you love good food, photos, videos and reels!! I\'92m definitely coming back to try more of their delights! \uc0\u55357 \u56845 \u55357 \u56845 "
\
Gusto has delicious pizzas and pastas. The pasta portions are a little small compared to other places but every one we ordered (we got all except the lasagna) was really yummy. The upstairs patio space is nicely laid out too. Be prepared to wait though as they do not take reservations.
\
I have been wanting to try this place since before the pandemic when my co-worker first told me about it. We visit Mississauga every year to visit family, but due to the pandemic, we haven't been in the past two years. The funghi pasta came highly recommended by my co-worker, so I had to try that. My husband and I also ordered the lamb meatballs for an appetizer, daviola pizza, the strip steak and tiramisu. The funghi pasta was AMAZING, and something that I would totally get every time. Everything else was really good too, cooked to perfection. Can't wait to come back again during our next visit.
\
"Got lasagna and the mushroom pasta here and it was fabulous. The serving of mushroom pasta was very filling and they were generous with the mushrooms too.\
\
The service was alright and the food took a very long time to come but they looked busy and perhaps understaffed so that couldn\'92t be helped.\
\
Overall, the pasta here made the experience so worth it and I would recommend it highly!"
\
The fungi cream pasta was Phenomenal. The steak, even more. You just can't go wrong. Make sure to start off with their Brussels sprouts if you're a fan. The fungi pizza was good but heavy if you're planning on having it among other things.
\
"Gusto 101 - Celebrating my big 4 0 today and the wifey planned a lovely luncheon. Definitely one of my favourite Italian joints in our great city.\
\
For starters we got the carpacccio and their newest salad the invernale (citrus, persimmons, fennel, olives and chilli). Both we absolutely delicious and light enough so we had room for our mains.\
\
Whenever you visit @gusto101to you must order their malfalde ai funghi and this time we also copped the grilled branzino (I love seafood). Both were executed perfectly and we left completely satisfied. What a great meal with amazing service! #TomEatsYummyFoodBecauseWhyNot"
\
Summer weather is definitely here and Gusto 101 is such a vibe to be at! There food is absolutely amazing and the staff are very friendly and accommodating! Definitely will be back to try the rest of their menu!
\
"One of the best Italian place in Toronto. Been a regular customer for a while now. If you want good food, cozy atmosphere, and good service this place is worth to visit.\
Their mushroom pasta definitely the best one in the city, not too heavy and the pasta is cooked perfectly. Their pizza is top notch

order their malfalde ai funghi and this time we also copped the grilled branzino (I love seafood). Both were executed perfectly and we left completely satisfied. What a great meal with amazing service! #TomEatsYummyFoodBecauseWhyNot"
\
Summer weather is definitely here and Gusto 101 is such a vibe to be at! There food is absolutely amazing and the staff are very friendly and accommodating! Definitely will be back to try the rest of their menu!
\
"One of the best Italian place in Toronto. Been a regular customer for a while now. If you want good food, cozy atmosphere, and good service this place is worth to visit.\
Their mushroom pasta definitely the best one in the city, not too heavy and the pasta is cooked perfectly. Their pizza is top notch as well. For appetizer I would recommend calamari. For tiramisu, it's decent but not the best one in town, the lady fingers not moist enough and doesn't absorb the coffee/espresso enough."
\
"I\'92ve been wanting to come to Gusto for the longest time and never got around to it. How have I put it off so long. The atmosphere and space is great for an intimate dinner to catching up with a group of friends. The drinks were on point and the food\'85 AMAZING rich flavour.\
\
Don\'92t be like me and wait for this, just go, run!"
\
Visited here with friends and had a great experience. We didnt have a reservation but had a seat at the rooftop bistro tables which weren\'92t really comfortable. The service was fast and nice, the food and drinks came on time and the cocktails were great. The truffle mushroom pasta was reallyyyyyyyy amazing and it was worth the hype. Also the burger was very juicy and flavorful, adding on the calamari was tasty and crispy as well. We will definitely come back again and would definitely recommend this place.
\
Gusto is always a good idea. Both locations  Offer beautiful patios with plenty of sunshine. The food is always consistent and service friendly.  Best part about the place is there a dollar ounce house wine and properly traditional Italian eats!
\
Great atmosphere and dining experience. Super charismatic and attentive staff. We greatly enjoyed the food and sitting at the bar. The Calamarata shrimp pasta was fresh and light; the Salsicce pizza with sausage was really delicious as well. A fluffy tiramisu and rich cannoli were delightful endings to our meal. Compliments to the chef!
\
The food was quite tasty. Started off with a lamb meatball and tomato sauce with burnt toast. Good taste minus the bread. The star here I would recommend is the pastas. One dish has lots of mushrooms and cream with truffle flavours the other is the bolognese with beef and pork which is meaty. Wish they would ask to add cheese and pepper though.
\
"A friend of mine recommended this bustling spot - and it wowed me!  The food was top notch, every bite was so flavourful. The beef carpaccio was the best I've ever had.  Every dish was absolutely amazing.   Definitely a new fav spot for comfort food!\
\
The tables are packed in quite tight, someone knocked a drink over on my table trying to squeeze in. (He very kindly got us a round-ty!)  The washrooms are communal which isn't my fav, but that's nbd when there are so many other positives.\
\
My server was Sydney, she was attentive and personable.  I highly recommend.\
I'll be back soon!\uc0\u55357 \u56842 "
\
Came here with friends; i liked their espresso martini. Their signature mafaldi ai funghi is a must-have, and I also very much enjoyed their bolognese.  The mafaldi sauce is quite rich and heavy so if you prefer a lighter pasta this wont be

fav spot for comfort food!\
\
The tables are packed in quite tight, someone knocked a drink over on my table trying to squeeze in. (He very kindly got us a round-ty!)  The washrooms are communal which isn't my fav, but that's nbd when there are so many other positives.\
\
My server was Sydney, she was attentive and personable.  I highly recommend.\
I'll be back soon!\uc0\u55357 \u56842 "
\
Came here with friends; i liked their espresso martini. Their signature mafaldi ai funghi is a must-have, and I also very much enjoyed their bolognese.  The mafaldi sauce is quite rich and heavy so if you prefer a lighter pasta this wont be for you.  I also had the cacio e pepe and I was very disappointed with that- i would say to avoid that dish.  Overall ambiance was great, would return for the initial two pasta dishes.
\
"The outside patio was a definitely a vibe!!\
Ordered the Polpette Di Carne , Matalde Al Funghi, and Tiramisu and would highly recommend all of these. Drinks were also great. The service was quick and the servers were amazing! Overall, satisfied with my visit and will be back again."
\
"The food is delicious. The Diavola pizza, pasta, foccacia, everything was really good and would recommend. The service unfortunately was lacking.\
My party of 5 had to go out of our way to find our server who was hanging out in the back chatting, and the bartender had to help us call for him so we can order. He also spilled water on our table while pouring water for us and we had to, again, go out of our way to request for napkins so we can clean up the water."
\
Good pasta and very aesthetic spot. The first floor is more intimate whereas the second floor is more spacious. The calamarata, lasagna and fried calamaris were great. It's a must-do (if you can get a spot) in the King West area!
\
"Not to many places I'd order the same meal on my next visit, but the pizza and pasta was so good I'd order it again. And you gotta try the purple kale ceasar salad, it was the star of the show.\
\
Make reservations and go here for a great date night.\
\
I would of gave it a 5 \uc0\u55356 \u57119 but it is alittle loud."
\
Gusto 101 was definitely one of the highlights of our Toronto visit. We ordered their house made focaccia, their famous Mafalde Ai Funghi (mushroom pasta) and the Calamarata (shrimp pomodoro pasta). While I wouldn't recommend their bread, the pasta is absolutely delicious - some of the best we've ever had. The mushroom pasta was covered in a truffle  cream sauce and was AMAZING. The calamarata was actually my personal favorite! I'm not big on wine, so I paired it with some Birra Moretti - an Italian lager that was light and refreshing. We didn't get a chance to order their pizza, but it looked excellent. I can't wait to come back again to try some of their other dishes.
\
"The place is always busy, I tried twice before to get a table but failed. Finally third time is the charm.\
\
The food is good but I find it overpriced compared to the quantity, it isn\'92t as fulfilling. I tried their mushroom truffle pasta, few cocktails and tiramisu, everything tasted delicious.\
\
They didn\'92t have much vegetarian/vegan options on their menu so that\'92s a bummer. I personally think it is overhyped.\
\
Italian food | Pasta | Tiramisu"
\
Tried the brussel sprouts & mushroom pasta. It was okay, nothing terribly special. Service was okay, a bit slow but kind of expected because it was busy. The chair i was seated at kept shaking every time

\

Tried the brussel sprouts & mushroom pasta. It was okay, nothing terribly special. Service was okay, a bit slow but kind of expected because it was busy. The chair i was seated at kept shaking every time someone walked by, I think it\'92s because of flooring. Not really something I would have again. Overall ok experience.
\
"They have literally the best truffle mushroom pasta anyone can ever ask for! If you come here you have to order this signature dish! It is so good\
\
Check out our Instagram @eatwithjessandjohn for more local eats"
\
"Everything was delicious and service was very nice.\
\
Docked a star because they knowingly sat us near a leaky window and we kept getting splashed by water while it was raining outside. Tip: either fix the leak or don\'92t seat your customers right underneath it!"
\
Went as a walk in and did not have to wait at all. Great place with great vibes. We ordered Mafalde ai funghi pasta, lamb meatballs, house made focaccia bread and moscow mule cocktail. I would definitely recommend the lamb meatballs and house made focaccia bread. However, we could not enjoy the pasta as it turned cold within 5 minutes. It was so cold and windy outside yet they had AC turned to a point which made our food too cold quickly within 5 minutes. Otherwise it would have been a 5 star review. Having said that, we really enjoyed our time there. The service was amazing. I loved how the server helped us with a huge smile.
\
"All dished was flavorful but not heavy.\
Great flavour. Roof top was an nice out and great experience."
\
This is a nice restaurant! Nothing remarkable, but it\'92s worth it as it\'92s not that pricey. Pastas are good. The cheesecake dessert was amazing. Beef carpaccio was okey.
\
"Our server was amazing! So knowledgeable about the wine selection and the food options. He was absolutely lovely. The wine paired beautifully with our pizza and pasta.\
The food was really good and we enjoyed the atmosphere and vibe. I\'92ll definitely be back!"
\
Food is amazing! Cocktail was ok. Mushroom pasta was so good that I forgot to take a picture\'85must-try!!
\
The food is good; it is hearty and feels homey. Customer service isn\'92t that great. Our waitress took 30 minutes to bring us the extra spoon that we requested; we already finished our meal by then.
\
Amazing Italian food in such a vibrant neighborhood. Their Lasagna is super delicious. And I'd also recommend trying  Pasta over pizza.
\
So delicious! Service was great! The restaurant was super busy and packed when we arrived, but everything arrived to our table in incredible timing and was so hot and fresh!
\
We always order in dinner from Gusto, and the experience is always amazing. One of the best and most simple pastas I have ever had, the pizza is also one of the best in Toronto. Today we decided to go have dinner in the restaurant and it was even better. The service was great, we didn\'92t do a reservation, but they gave us a sit right away. The food arrives fast and it was as good as the other times we ordered in. The drinks were also well done. Gusto is a must have!
\
Whenever I'm in Toronto, I always make a stop at Gusto. The Mafalde Ai

delicious! Service was great! The restaurant was super busy and packed when we arrived, but everything arrived to our table in incredible timing and was so hot and fresh!
\
We always order in dinner from Gusto, and the experience is always amazing. One of the best and most simple pastas I have ever had, the pizza is also one of the best in Toronto. Today we decided to go have dinner in the restaurant and it was even better. The service was great, we didn\'92t do a reservation, but they gave us a sit right away. The food arrives fast and it was as good as the other times we ordered in. The drinks were also well done. Gusto is a must have!
\
Whenever I'm in Toronto, I always make a stop at Gusto. The Mafalde Ai Funghi (pasta with truffle cream sauce) and Cavollo Nero (kale salad) and tiramisu were absolutely delightful. Their house wines are still $1/oz and I am just the happiest glowing girl. The service slaps.
\
I love the MAFALDE AI FUNGHI pasta. However, the last time I went to gusto it didn\'92t taste as good, wasn\'92t as rich as it used to be (in comparison to pre-Covid days). The pasta sauce was way more rich and thick with a lot more flavour but now it\'92s more watered down. Regardless, I still love this pasta. Ambience is great as well. The no reservation policy is terrible if you\'92re driving from a far distance. Rating it a 4 due to inconvenience of the policy and inconsistency in the pasta.
\
Gusto 101 is one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. We tried their burger,  pastas and the pepperoni pizza! I\'92d give the food 4/5 and the dessert! OMGosh! Pistachio cannolis\'85. Are to die for -5/5 must try !
\
"If you are looking for Italian food with a kick of spices - this is the place to come to. However get ready for some mixed service expectations. Ill elaborate below.\
\
Food: Fantastico! We ordered 2 pizzas and a pasta - all of them were delicious. The pasta could be boiled for some more time as it was crunchy, but the quality of mushrooms and truffle was top-notch!\
\
Service: a little mixed about this. They gave us a table close to the kitchen which made it a little hot. My wife was having back pain so we requested to sit by the sofa but the first 2 servers just declined our request outright in a very rude manner. They were giving excuses that those tables are booked for bigger groups while we saw similar tables with only 2 guests on each table. In addition, this restaurant does not take reservations. A 3rd server approached us and we requested her and showed her the sofa tables with 2 guests. She was kind enough to check with the manager and we finally got a table with sofa. Our server was superb who helped us get a table and we complained to her about the other servers who were rude and did not help with our requests.\
\
Honestly I want to give this place 5 stars but the initial servers spoiled our mood and experience. The food is superb with some minor opportunities for improvement, but the main problem that the management needs to fix is the hospitality of the servers."
\
"This place was on our radar for two years and we ended up making it here last week.\
Being here for the first time we stuck to their house baked focaccia to begin with and for mains we tried the traditional Margherita ( one can never go wrong with this classic) and the Iconic Mafalde ai Funghi which was out of this world. Such an amazing ambience with warm and Rustic fine Italian vibes, the food and the service was top notch.\
Will be back soon again."
\
Great food! The kale salad, margarita pizza and truffle pasta all were delicious. Very nice staff.
\

\

Such an amazing ambience with warm and Rustic fine Italian vibes, the food and the service was top notch.\
Will be back soon again."
\
Great food! The kale salad, margarita pizza and truffle pasta all were delicious. Very nice staff.
\
I don\'92t know why I didn\'92t visit sooner! Food was awesome! Soo goood that I wanted to lick my plate after because the Malfade Al Funghi was amazing! Burger + fries & aioli was so yummy! Can\'92t forget about the Beef Carpaccio \uc0\u55358 \u56588 \u55356 \u57340  We waited a little while for our food but the hosts had such great customer service and offered dessert on the house to us.
\
"Finally got to try this place! I've been to Nervosa but never Gusto all these years. I was happy to discover recently before trying Gusto that they have the same owners and the famous mushroom Truffle pasta and Margherita Pizza from Nervosa is the exact same offered at Gusto!\
\
We ordered:\
Beef Carpaccio\
Margherita Pizza\
12oz Bistecca\
Mafalde Ai Funghi\
Mavalcea\
Tequila\
\
The Carpaccio was good, very mild tasting and the beans on top was a nice balance in flavor. Pizza was same as I remember from Nervosa as well as my all time favourite Madalde Ai Funghi with their homemade pasta noodles!\
They actually overcooked the steak from medium rare to medium well but it was still soft as a good cut so we didn't complain to the server.\
\
Looking forward to trying the kale salad next time!"
\
This place is superb! The most authentic Italian restaurant you could have ever visited. The pastas we tried were amazing and very flavourful. We will be definitely coming back.
\
Their Mafalde Al Funghi is super popular, I love the mix of oyster mushrooms and truffle cream sauce with the pasta. We also tried out the Diavola which was super yummy, I loved the salami and roasted peppers.
\
"Came downtown to visit this well know place. We arrived around 5..line up. My suggestion is give ppl the opportunity to scan the QR code while waiting in line not when they are near the front.\
We were directed to go upstairs( poor lighting in the stairwell).\
Our server was excellent. Attentive and friendly.\
We had a few appetizers and a pizza. I have to say with all the hype about this restaurant I wasn't blown away. Although the arancini looked good, the taste just wasn't impressive.\
My husband had the lamb meatballs and they were good smothered in a nice tomato sauce.\
The pizza was good ( thin crisp crust), pretty good flavour . I guess I was expecting better.\
We got a bottle of wine  ($67)-that was  a pretty big mark up for a mediocre bottle of Italian red.\
The ambiance was pretty good. We were seated by a window that overlooked some garbage area ( out of the window).- which I think could be easily  remedied by some opaque window film.\
Probably wouldn't return when there are  sooo many others to choose from.\uc0\u55358 \u56631 \u8205 \u9792 \u65039 "
\
"Gusto101 has been my favourite Italian spot when it comes to pasta

husband had the lamb meatballs and they were good smothered in a nice tomato sauce.\
The pizza was good ( thin crisp crust), pretty good flavour . I guess I was expecting better.\

\
"Gusto101 has been my favourite Italian spot when it comes to pasta and dessert. Definitely a must try at least once in your life!\
\
Pictured:\
\'93Mafalde Ai Funghi\'94 - it comes with 3 kinds of mushroom - portobello, porcini, oyster mushrooms, and the pasta is cooked to al dente with truffle cream sauce! Yum!!\
I\'92d suggest to order \'93Cavolo Nero\'94 - lacinato kale, zante currants, toasted pinenuts, pecorino, parmigiano, lemon vinaigrette - to balance out the pasta.\
\
And their tiramisu is so creamy & delicious. Much-needed to end your amazing meal\
\
Follow my IG: @astravel_eats"
\
"Have visited Gusto 101 a few times and am delighted every time. This Italian restaurant has a wonderful ambiance, good music, and very professional staff who pay attention to details. The upstairs dining was closed as it was a Sunday.\
\
For starters, we ordered the Carpaccio and Burrata. The Carpaccio was delicious, complimentary flavours that all worked together, especially the mushrooms and parmagiano! The Burrata cheese was very good, however it could have used an extra flavour to complete the dish.\
\
For our main, we had the Malfade ai Fungahi and the Lamb Meatballs. The Malfade is Fungahi is to die for and arguably the best dish in the city and the best pasta dish I have personally had! It is a mushroom pasta dish - so creamy and rich with a truffle cream sauce over al dents wide pasta. Would eat this every day!! The Lamb Meatballs were perfectly seasoned and served with a dollop of ricotta. The only suggestion I would have is to add a nice sear on the meatballs to provide some texture. But it was still very good.\
\
Overall a great experience. We drove over an hour to come here and it did not disappoint. Will come back for sure! Please provide me a recommendation of what I should try next!"
\
"Overall great food from the meatballs, octopus, pizza and all the pasta\
\
Octopus - probably one of the best in the city\
\
Mafalde Ai Funghi - best pasta at Gusto"
\
No Same day reservations. Walk in only. The place was very busy. The ambiance of the place was cool and nice. It is a little loud since it's packed. The food is ok lot of other Italian restaurants with better food and cheaper option. The service was nice and friendly. The staff was always around when you needed it. Both booth and other tables could seat a group of 4 but they didn\'92t let us sit at the booth.\
\
We were offered to sit up stairs at first but it was far too busy and loud for a date like dinner so we opted for a middle seat on the ground floor right by the kitchen. Throughout our night no one sat at the booth which we had originally requested (even though they said someone called but on their website and phone they at no reservations and only accept walk ins). Whatever, our waiter wasn\'92t the most personable or relatable, did what he had to do but didn\'92t make any extra effort to make our night special. Didn\'92t have a conversation. Anti social.\
\
Our Mafalde Al Funghi was just alright, it had been much more tastier before, something was missing. Seemed the pasta was hard not soft. I had a feeling this wouldn\'92t be free so I was okay with it but I didn\'92t think it would be $12, that\'92s fine but a warning would be nice. This is more of a heads up.\
\
Overall, I think we will give gusto another chance perhaps in the summer but for now it left a kind of bad impression where we will look for other restaurants for our pasta cravings."

"We traveled into Toronto for the weekend from NY and were seeking a modern Italian cuisine. Gusto 101 exceeded our expectations for a number of reasons. The balance of hint of sweetness of the fig and creaminess of the burrata cheese balances each other out, and it very complimentary with the bread.

Service: The staff was very friendly and there when you need them, and served our orders fairly quickly.

Food: 5/5 - My boyfriend and I had our date night here, because Gusto is on my MUST go spots in Toronto. There's a lot of hype and I can see why; this place just hits different for the both of us. You need to see the descriptions of the items we got to share below for more mind-blowing details.

- Mafalde Al Funghi [GET]: OMG, insanely al dente pasta with an unbelievable sauce. The sauce was so truffle-y, rich, and smooth. It was so delicious, and probably one of the creamiest and silkiest pasta cream sauce I've had besides at other high-end restaurants. It is PERFECTLY cooked with an amazing texture, and definitely beautifully executed. Each bite was heavenly and irresistible. I love the huge chucks of portobello, porcini oyster mushrooms and parmesan cheese on top, they didn't skimp out on the ingredients. It also added an additional layer of texture for sure! Beware though, it can get heavy towards the end, but my boyfriend didn't mind it.

- Pepperoni [GET]: Whoa! Pizza exceeded my expectations. The pizza is thin crust with a chewy dough and crust, very similar texture to the ones I've had in Europe. You need to eat fast before it gets soggy, otherwise you can use a knife and a fork, HAHA. I love the pomodoro tomato sauce. It's acidic and tangy, pairs wonderfully with the fresh mozzarella cheese. The pepperoni tastes homemade, fresh, and meaty. The buckwheat honey and funnel oil drizzled on top was chef's kiss. If you haven't try honey on pizza, definitely as soon as possible.

- Focaccia Bread [GET]: Gusto's freshly made focaccia bread. First, they are thick, but super light, fluffy, and pillow-y. I just wished it was toasted a bit more though. It is also greasy, but in a very good way. I see them drizzle a good amount of olive oil before they serve it, and that olive oil elevates the bread so much. I don't know what it is, but the olive oil added an interesting umami flavor to it, and it was delicious. The rosemary works so harmoniously and balances so well with the bread. You have to get this too!

Ambiance: 4.75/5 - The vibe is awesome, and the perfect spot for date nights. We decided to sit in the main dining room, where it's dimly lit with candles on each table, brick walls, and open kitchen, and giving me a speakeasy vibe. The tables are kind of close to each other and not much room to wiggle around and expect it to be packed with people. There's an upstairs patio with a large glass roof and open windows, but definitely louder and got a more causal vibe. It is better for a large group of people.

Price: 4/5 - We got the focaccia bread as our starter for $6. For entrees, we got the truffle pasta for $26, and the pepperoni pizza for $19, and prices are before tax. The total came up to be around $60 for the two of us. This place can be a bit pricey compared to other places, but

Our staff was friendly and prompt, greeted us immediately and constantly filling out our water glasses throughout the night. He provided some nice recommendations on pizza and was kind enough to take a picture for my boyfriend and me as well.

BLUF: Italian food has been the quintessential go to restaurants for me, especially when I get to pick our date night spots. Gusto serves some of the best truffle pasta and delicious pizza in GTA at some very reasonable prices. I highly recommend the truffle pasta, indeed the MUST get item here, and maybe add the focaccia bread too so you can use it to finish up the leftover creamy truffle sauce. Lastly, I would 100% come back anytime! \ We came here on a Saturday late afternoon with a reservation and was seated right away. It was my first time coming after hearing about all the hype, but it was not what I expected.
For whatever reason, the food came out weirdly quickly, which makes me think it was not freshly cooked. We ordered one pasta and one lasagna and they were both just warm, and very quickly turned cold.

Overall, my experience was not the best, for the price I wish they would pay more attention to the details like making the food at least hot. \ The service was very attentive. The server asked if we have any allergies and was good at accommodating them. The ambiance was nice, but the tables were too close together. I felt like I was eating with strangers. The food was disappointing. We ordered the calamari which was undercooked and the flavour felt a little lazy, not fresh for the price of $20! The pizza was burnt on the sides and the flavour was not particularly amazing for the price. The only thing I thought they nailed was the salad which I mean was good but not the reason we went there. I was excited to go, but won't be back again .. there are plenty of amazing Italian spots in Toronto and this was not one for me. \ We dropped by for a casual weekend dinner on the rooftop (enclosed) patio last month, and were seated promptly despite being early for our reservation.

My lasagna on the other hand was delicious. Just the right amount of sauce/meat and the lasagna sheets were perfectly cooked, and just a little crispy on top.

We tried:
Burrata: I'm not usually a fan of beets but these were delicious and the sweet and savouriness of the pickled complemented the creamy burrata well

Carpaccio: This was good, however I felt the flavor profiles were a bit flat, I cant put my finger on it!

Malfadeal funghi: Literally came for this and it was soooo delish. The pasta was perfectly al dente and the truffle cream was aromatic. I will deff come back for this

Cavelo Nero: I found this kale salad to be too tangy and missing extra sweetness to balance out the salt/acidity

Diavola: I'm not usually a pizza fan but this was delicious! the tomato pesto, smoked provolone, salami and peppers all worked beautifully together. The first one (pictured) was a bit burnt since its cooked in a wood oven but the second one turned out perfect

Tiramisu: Not pictured bc we were lazy after all the wine lol but it was surprisingly delicious! The portion was big enough to share and the espresso wasn't too overpowering

Pro tip: Did you know they have $1/ounce house red/white wine off the menu?! Crazy cheap price for dine-in and the wine was decent too! The prices are very reasonable, and food is tasty. I'd definitely come back and try more of their menu or whenever I'm craving some truffle mushroom pasta \ TLDR: Great restaurant, with proper service, but absolutely stellar MAFALDE AI FUNGHI

(Slightly) longer review for those not in a hurry:

Taste (4.5/5) :

I've tried most of the pastas on their menus, and also some of their appetizers! Everything was always fresh and delicious, and you can tell that the pasta is made in-house, because the pasta was always a delectable al dente. However, the dish I absolutely adore is the Mafalde Al Funghi. It's a pasta with portobello, porcini, oyster mushrooms, truffle cream sauce. This i definitely THE dish to get. During the summer there was also a peach mozarella dish that was also super refreshing and still makes my mouth tingle thinking about it Love how they have some seasonal items to try out.

Though it's very obvious that the Gusto 101 ethos and style is very different, I would put Gusto 101 at a similar level to Scaddabush, if not for the funghi pasta, which is why I've deducted half a star from 5 for flavour.

Although I am no wine person, it's worth noting that my friends also enjoyed the wine selection available here to pair with your meal :)

Experience: One of our favourite Italian restaurants, as their dishes are elevated above what we've ever expected. I personally love their mushroom pasta, as we come exclusively for that alone some times (it also travels well so the take-out version is great). Other great dishes include the Kale salad (basic but boogie) and beef tartare. They also have in-house wine (red and white) that you can pour by the oz, which lets you either go easy for the night or a hard as you want.

An elevated classic Italian restaurant is what I would call Gusto. I would highly recommend! \ Didn't know i could've made reservations for NYE but was really lucky i got to end the year here! \ I had been wanting to come here to celebrate special occasions since 2014 but somehow just missed the opportunity and every time ended up dining at chain restaurants. Fast forward to 2021 while visiting Downtown Toronto, I finally went to Gusto 101 for a date night with my husband. It was not very crowded on a Sunday night. We were seated immediately, as socially distanced as possible from other tables. The inside of the restaurant has a nice, romantic and rustic charm with tea lights at each table - nice for a date night but not spaced out if you're looking for privacy. The tables are quite close and you could easily hear the conversations at the next table. But that's the case with many restaurants downtown that have an intimate setting. We did not get to see their rooftop patio since it was closed for winter. For appetizers we shared an order of the arancini which was good but on the sweet side due to the saffron risotto in it. For mains I ordered their popular mushroom pasta, it was really delicious and worth the hype. My husband got the Margherita pizza - the crust was thin and quite soggy towards the middle of the pizza almost like a wrap! I really liked the sauce on the pizza though. For dessert we got the tiramisu. Every dish had extremely small portion sizes. Also our waiter took very long to come to our table to take orders for food, drinks and also to bring the bill. been here, it's been busy. Especially now during COVID-19 (hello future readers who have lived past this pandemic), there are fewer seating options and I see a lot of people doing take out. We've been incredibly lucky. We came early each time so they always had a little table for us within minutes. Plus it helps that we know exactly what we want.

Food flies out of this kitchen quickly. I never feel like it's much time before something edible is plopped infront of me. And the servers are always around tending to the tables, pouring more water in the glasses, and making sure everyone's happy... but in a way where they aren't constantly asking you how everything is while you have the biggest possible piece of food in your mouth. No, they give us space and are there once we need them. Perfect!

You have got to try the black kale salad (cavolo nero?). It's so good, their chef shared the recipe on CBC or some news channel a while back. I love it. Tangy, a little sweet, nutty, and all the freshness of black kale. Texture wise, it's soft and easy to chew through because it's been sitting in the citrusy dressing. Then that shaved parm on top. WHEW!

And then we go for the mushroom pasta. It looks like a deceptively small portion when you first see it. But the pasta is dense and chewy and the sauce is rich. You got the truffles, the mushroom, the umami deliciousness all around. It's exactly my type of pasta.

We've also had pizza and other dishes which have all been amazing, but I am a creature of habit. I tend to return to the same dishes.

AND for the dessert, if they have olive oil cake on the menu, do give it a try. For anyone that hasn't had olive oil cake before, it tastes so good. great hit of strong flavoured olive oil in a dense cake with light, herby, sweet toppings like fresh thyme and gelato. It's perfect, I didn't think I would like it as much as I did.

Really worth coming in to take a look. Try it out. Book a reso if you plan to come after 7pm. It's a wonderful vibe, cute restaurant, great service, great food. \ I like Italian food. Quite interesting place, very nice people. Thank you so much! \ I'm so glad that Gusto is still offering great take-out options during the covid pandemic. Definitely one of Toronto's great quality food venues, but I wish I could have experienced my food indoors again. Please take us back to when it was before lockdown. \ I've always wanted to visit this highly rated restaurant, but never ended up going before things went off the rails. There was nothing wrong with the rigatoni, but it wasn't what I had ordered and I wasn't too impressed with it.

I was asked whether I wanted both at the same time or banana bread first, and I said I'll take whatever's ready first. The food came out quickly, and the banana bread came first. Came here for my birthday with a few gal pals - we'd been meaning to try the place out for ages. The staff and management here are great: they'll have you seated right away and don't hesitate to cater to any adjustments you may request to your order. The ambience is almost on par with joints like Scaddabush.

I ordered the Diavola (spicy salami pizza!), while my mates opted for their Pappardelle (lamb ragu pasta) and Mafalde (truffle mushroom pasta). We all took advantage of their $1/oz house wine (they offer both red and white). The wine itself wasn't anything special, but paired with food it went down well enough.

My pizza was pretty good in terms of flavour - save for the fact that it was dripping in oil. I was surprised to find the crust so paper thin, as its not my go to when I picture my ideal slice (but some may prefer theirs this way). A singular giant basil leaf placed in the off-center as an after thought left the dish looking a bit messy.

Both of my friends received cold pasta (not room temperature, COLD) which we were shocked about, but our server quickly took the plates back for reheating and the manager came out to offer an apology. After their food was once again edible, I tried some and wasn't impressed. The Pappardelle tasted undercooked and was plated in a lasagna style making it difficult to cut through, and the ragu itself was mediocre at best in terms of flavour. The Malfalde was gooey in consistency and I personally found the truffle cream sauce to be overpowering and not complimentary to this dish. Upon her first bite my friend immediately noted that the dish tasted exactly the same as the mushroom pasta at Trattoria Nervosa (a sister restaurant to Gusto).

As a fan of the other restaurants under the Gusto54 umbrella corporation (Chubby's & PAI in particular) I was a little disappointed that their Italian dining experience didn't live up to the standards I would have expected from a place with such high reviews.

Sometimes ordering can be a hit or miss, and these were most definitely a miss. Our little group was in unanimous agreement - we'd much rather be at Pizza Libretto or Grazie than here. \ This is a fantastic establishment with embodies delicious Italian cuisine and a culture that resembles Italy. It has a really vibrant, open roof top and a nice, buzzing, dim indoor space. Both areas are loud and roudy and give a great environment to hang, grab food and grab a drink with friends.

I got the infamous Mafalde Al Funghi which is basically their mushroom, truffle pasta! The shape of Mafalde is perfect for picking up the super delicious truffle cream sauce and making each bite so good as you soak in that savoury, creamy sauce. They could've definitely plated the food better and I was originally skeptical when it arrived. But when I had it I was surprised how simple and elegant the dish was, yet it was so tasty. I wish the portions were bigger though for the $22 I had to pay!

They have their own house wine on tap for $1 per ounce! So it was $5 for a glass of wine, which is ridiculously cheap and it tasted pretty reasonable as well! (Another thing that resembles Italy! Cheap wine while you eat your meal!)

All in all, I enjoy this restaurant and I'll definitely come back again! \ My favourite dish to order here is their mushroom truffle pasta (Mafalde Ai Funghi). Very rich, creamy and flavourful! A bit pricey but

on the menu. \ Husband and I came here for brunch on a Sunday. We were seated upstairs in nice weather, and everyone from the hosts and server were very nice though not overly attentive (we had to flag our server down a couple of times). It wasn't crowded and the fresh air was nice. We ordered the special of the day, mushroom pasta, the steak off the brunch menu, and the panna cotta.

The mushroom pasta was delicious even if the presentation left much to be desired. The flavors of truffle really shone through and was present in every bite. The portion looked small, about half of what you'd find in American restaurants and a third of pasta dishes in Italy, but with how much truffle they used, I'm not surprised or disappointed. Quality over quantity any day.

The steak was a nice surprise--flank (I think is what they used) tends to be lean, but the chef treated it very well so that it was juicy and flavorful. The egg was perfect, and though I have hated beans all my life, these smelled so good and were seasoned so well that I actually ate a few bites before the texture triggered my dislike. The peppers probably could've been saut\'e9ed for a shorter amount of time, but now I'm just being picky. There were many elements on the dish, but all worked well together.

We had hoped that the panna cotta would remind us of our trips to Italy, but it was quite different. This felt more of a pudding or a custard, and the preserves they used were overpowering for our non-sweet tooth. We both had to rinse our mouths after.

The only real issue we came across was finding a short, dark hair in the pasta. When I was celebrating a professional achievement last week, picking a restaurant for lunch was a no-brainer. I knew my suburban-dwelling family would be all over the flavour, coziness, and warmth of Gusto 101.

I was right.

all over the flavour, coziness, and warmth of Gusto 101.

I was right.

We were a large group with a reservation, and Gusto was able to accommodate an earlier arrival than scheduled (great!). They were also able to get us in and out within ~60 minutes, and I'm talking 6 meals, dessert, and coffee. Very impressive!

Now, on to the food. I always order the Cavolo Nero and Mafalde Funghi. Always. These are my ol' reliables. I know what I'm getting, and I'm blown away each time. The cavolo nero is a light and zesty kale salad, that is topped with shaved Parmesan and lightly toasted pine nuts. This salad is an absolute dream, especially on a hot day. I've tried recreating it at home, but Gusto has a way with it that I'll sadly never replicate! The mafalde funghi is just as impressive. The creamy mushroom sauce contains layer upon layer of mushroomy flavour. If you like mushrooms, this is the dish for you! Unsurprisingly, these dishes were a hit with my family!

We also tried a couple of new things: the branzino fish and margarita pizza. The branzino was crispy on the outside and light and flaky on the inside. It was so unfortunate that we were all sharing, otherwise I could finish it all by myself! The margarita pizza was not as epic but it was still a solid pizza! The crust was thin and crispy, the toppings fresh but not overwhelming with flavour. It tasted just the way a margarita pizza should taste.

The dessert: the coffee was epic in every sense of the word. When it arrived at the table, everyone commented on how the coffee must have been really good. It was brown and frothy. Dark and rich. You knew you were getting real Italian coffee. We paired our coffees with the cannoli, which to be honest, were not the best I've ever had (shoutout to L'Unita) but they hit the spot!

Verdict: head over to Gusto for lunch or dinner. Grab a seat inside or on the rooftop patio. You won't regret it! \ Fresh fish, quality pasta and an above average cup of espresso make this livley Italian restaraunt the place to be if you are near the core.

* house-baked foccacia bread bucket x 2 - seriously addicting, but would taste even better if it was complimentary :P
* burrata served with sweet heirloom tomatoes and fragrant olive oil
* mushroom bruschetta (one per person) - MUST-GET!! cheesy, crunchy, and full of umami flavor

For entrees, most of us ordered the signature pasta dish: truffle funghi, which was creamy, indulgent, and perfect for carb-lovers. Portion was generous, so I'd recommend sharing esp. if you plan to go ham on the starters like we did.

Service was friendly, attentive, and accommodating. For example, they were able to serve 7 pieces of bruschetta even when standard order came in 3 pieces. We had a complicated check split request, and they showed no qualms about it.
